attributes.title: A physical Stock Take
attributes.description:
A physical stock take was conducted on 27 February 2025 to assess whether the physical stock counted matched with the book balance.

It was noted that there were zero or minimal variations between the physical and the book stocks in most items except

v  Poly bags had cumulative variance of +1,360 pieces

v  Bread stock had short fall of 5 loaves.

The table below illustrates the findings.
attributes.recommendation:
The branch needs to tighten stock controls to reduce the variations noted packing materials

The branch management should ensure that the quantity of the poly bags damages stock out are accurate and verifiable
attributes.effect:
Effective controls were noted on Raw materials and bread stock.

Weak controls were noted on poly bags resulting in significant loss.

value:
Stock is okay.

In the previous stock poly bags always have a positive variation
We need to control and do a close follow up on polybags
In a prior report dated 23rd January 2025  it was noted that most stock items had nil variations with exception to bread stock which had a variance of +33.5pcs, and poly bags +176pcs.
Previous
The internal audit team, in collaboration with the branch team, conducted a physical stock take on 4th June 2025,

attributes.title: Bread Weight
attributes.description:
A sample of bread produced and packed in the branch was randomly selected and weighed. The aim was to check whether bread sent to the market was of the minimum weight as set by KEBS.

Underweights were observed across all varieties sampled except on 600 BW. The table below illustrates the findings: -
attributes.recommendation:
The branch management should enhance the frequency of checks at the dividing table to ensure that the dividers adhere to the dividing range.

KAF should install control panel to help on setting time,
attributes.effect: The underweight should be discouraged since it may cost the company unnecessary fines due to non-compliance to laid down standards of operation as per the regulatory body (KEBS).

value:
Underweight was caused by overcooling and long baking time resulting to high moisture loss.

We have a challenge where all ovens don’t have control panel so it is very hard to baking set time
I need to increase my spot checks on dough to make sure dividers adhere to the correct dividing range
The findings revealed that packed bread underweight were noted as follows; 400g - 16%, 600g - 9%, while 800g W - 19%.
Previous

attributes.title: Bread damages Analysis
attributes.description:
Analysis of production and market damages was done to determine whether bread damages were within the allowed percentage of 0.20% to total production and 0.50% of total sales.

The audit sample period was the month of February 25. The flowing were the findings: -

v  Production Damages were averaging at 0.21% of the total production

v  Marker damages stood at 0.38% of the total sales which was within the allowable percentage of 0.50%.

The table below illustrates details of the findings: 

Table 1 Analysis of Production Damages

         Table 2 Analysis of Market Damages
attributes.recommendation:
The branch management should control damages by ensuring that all production procedures are being followed and produce bread of good quality so as to reduce production damages and market returns.

Maintenances department needs to check oven to identify the reasons for oven baking uneven
attributes.effect:
Production damages slightly surpassed the set limit of 0.20% by 0.01%. This resulted to a revenue loss of Ksh.3,061.77

Market damages were within the set limit of 0.5%.

value: Production damages were contributed by baking unevenly.
All procedures should be strictly followed to reduce damages.
During the prior audit it was noted that production damages were 0.20% of the total production while market damages were 0.38% of the total sales.
Current

attributes.title: Damages sent to Ingredients’ Balance Analysis
attributes.description:
Bread damages sent to ingredients were computed to establish whether damages sent match with damages captured on the SAP systems. The audit period was from 1 February 2025 to 28 February 2025.

There was no noted significant difference between total damages at the branch level and damages sent to ingredients damages. Total branch damages were 5,177.35 pieces while those sent to ingredients were 5,097.25 pieces, resulting in a variance of -80.10 pieces of bread.

Below is summary of the findings:
attributes.recommendation: Branch management to put measures in place to weigh and verify all daily damage broken and sent to ingredients so as to reflect the accurate status of declared and available damages.
attributes.effect: The less damages sent to ingredients implies weak control on recording of damages.

value: The variance noted majorly contributed by moisture loss. But we will make follow up and ensure damages sent match with damages recorded.
I will make sure every time damages being sent to ingredients the department manager should be physically there for confirmation purposes
During the prior audit it was noted that damages sent to ingredients had a negligible variance of -3.70 Kgs equivalent to 9.25 loaves.
Previous

attributes.title: Analysis of the Mixing chart
attributes.description:
An analysis of both mixing chart and mixing chart summary were done for a period of 23 days from 1 February 2025 to 28 February 2025.

Below is summary of the findings.

v  Utto consumption stood at 100 %.

v  Average yield was 192.74 loaves per bag.

v  Average production was 152.32 bags per day this represent 84.62% of the set target of 180 bags.

v  There was accuracy of figures transferred from mixing chart summary to cash flow for the period audited.

The table shows the summary findings of the mixing chart
attributes.recommendation: The branch should strive to ensure that they attain their target
attributes.effect: Production target was not met meaning the branch had some idle capacity resulting unabsorbed fixed cost and other opportunity costs.

value: The production is affected by low sales that prompts to shift cuts in order to control bread balanceProduction is affected by low sales that prompts to shift cuts in order to control bread balance
·   Mostly target were not met because of low sales.
In prior audit production target was averaged at 149.05 bags per day
